FuncDef:
The cmp request authentication-cert command configures a certificate for identity authentication in a CMPv2 request.
The undo cmp request authentication-cert command deletes a certificate for identity authentication in a CMPv2 request.
By default, no certificate is configured for identity authentication in a CMPv2 request.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a certificate file name.
The value is a string of 1 to 63 characters.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If you need to use CMPv2 to apply for a certificate, run the cmp request authentication-cert command to configure a certificate for identity authentication. An initiation registration (IR) carries the default certificate of the device.
